repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Urban Land Management
            and Housing Finance Reform Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Urban Land Management
            and Housing Finance Reform Technical Assistance Project is
            rated as unsatisfactory, sustainability as unlikely,
            institutional development impact as modest, Bank performance
            as unsatisfactory, and Borrower performance as
            unsatisfactory. Project implementation was delayed by the
            unsettling economic and political situations especially
            during the latter part of the project. There were five
            changes in the government and many changes of key officials
            within the concerned ministries. There was even a coup
            d'etat during the final year of the project. Lessons
            learned from this project include: 1) To address land
            management issues in Africa, it requires full government
            commitment and should be addressed with a step-by-step
            approach beginning with basic building blocks before
            proceeding to a broader agenda. 2) Reform is more likely to
            be achieved by focusing on key policy and institutional
            improvements rather than a broad-based detailed reform
            agenda. 3) When new agencies are being established there
            need to be intensive supervision missions, especially at the
            beginning, to carefully follow up on the agreed work program
            with the implementing agency. This is especially important
            during the initial phases of the project and particularly so
            when a new agency such as AGEF (Land Management Agency) is
            created. 4) A carefully prepared procurement plan is
            necessary from the time of appraisal to enable
            implementation to begin quickly and smoothly.

694449.trustfund:
TF023132-PHRD-FINANCIAL SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT PROJ.,TF023094-PHRD-CHINA CONSTRUCTION BANK
            TRANSFORMATION PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivorie - Urban Land Management
            and Housing Finance Reforms Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Urban Land Management and Housing
            Finance Reforms Technical Assistance Project will support
            the detailed definition and beginning of implementation of a
            reform package for improving the efficiency and equity of
            urban land and housing markets. Specifically, it will: (i)
            promote the development of a market for the provision of
            serviced land and housing, especially to moderate and low
            income households; (ii) foster private investment in
            housing; and (iii) strengthen the capacity of public and
            private sector institutions involved in the development and
            management of urban land and housing delivery. The project
            will support pilot operations in land titling, management
            and development, as well as, data management. The project
            consist of three components: a) land management reform,
            namely i) creating and launching the Agence de Gestion
            Fonciere (AGEF), ii) developing through concession, iii)
            reducing development costs, iv) clearing the titling
            backlog, and v) privatizing public real state; b) housing
            finance reform by i) creating and launching the Societe de
            Refinancement Hypothecaire (SRH), ii) creating a security
            fund, iii) enforcing foreclosures, iv) stimulating the real
            state market, and v) stimulating housing savings; and c)
            capacity building consisting of i) land management support
            operations, ii) tax base management, iii) public housing
            management, iv) develop professional and research training
            at the University on Urban and Real Estate Law, and v)
            promote the organization of the developers' profession.
